item.title: Robert add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I can, with one eye squinted, take it all as a blessing." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Robert add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Robert add a quote by Frank O'Hara
item.description: "There should be so much more, not of orange, of words, of how terrible orange is and life." -- Frank O'Hara

item.title: Robert add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "What goes on inside is just too fast and huge and all interconnected for words to do more than barely sketch the outlines of at most one tiny little part of it at any given instant." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Robert add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Robert add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Robert add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Depression is boring, I think and I would do better to make some soup and light up the cave." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Robert add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "What was any art but a mold to imprison for a moment the shining elusive element which is life itself- life hurrying past us and running away, to strong to stop, too sweet to lose." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Robert add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty." -- Socrates

item.title: Robert add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "Fiction is the lie that helps us understand the truth." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Robert add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Robert add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robert add a quote by G.E. Lessing
item.description: "Think wrongly, if you please, but in all cases think for yourself." -- G.E. Lessing

item.title: Robert add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "People live through such pain only once. Pain comes again—but it finds a tougher surface." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There was never yet an uninteresting life. Such a thing is an impossibility. Inside of the dullest exterior there is a drama, a comedy, and a tragedy." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robert add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "I've forgotten most of what I've read and, frankly, it never seemed very important to me or to the world." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Robert add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Robert add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The so-called ‘psychotically depressed’ person who tries to kill herself doesn’t do so out of quote ‘hopelessness’ or any abstract conviction that life’s assets and debits do not square. And surely not because death seems suddenly appealing. The person in whom Its invisible agony reaches a certain unendurable level will kill herself the same way a trapped person will eventually jump from the window of a burning high-rise. Make no mistake about people who leap from burning windows. Their terror of falling from a great height is still just as great as it would be for you or me standing speculatively at the same window just checking out the view; i.e. the fear of falling remains a constant. The variable here is the other terror, the fire’s flames: when the flames get close enough, falling to death becomes the slightly less terrible of two terrors. It’s not desiring the fall; it’s terror of the flames. And yet nobody down on the sidewalk, looking up and yelling ‘Don’t!’ and ‘Hang on!’, can understand the jump. Not really. You’d have to have personally been trapped and felt flames to really understand a terror way beyond falling." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Robert add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Robert add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Robert add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Robert add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Live or die, but don't poison everything." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Robert add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "because wherever I sat—on the deck of a ship or at a street café in Paris or Bangkok—I would be sitting under the same glass bell jar, stewing in my own sour air." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Robert add a quote by Kay Redfield Jamison
item.description: "If I can't feel, if I can't move, if I can't think, and I can't care, then what conceivable point is there in living?" -- Kay Redfield Jamison

item.title: Robert add a quote by Ashly Lorenzana
item.description: "You know all that sympathy that you feel for an abused child who suffers without a good mom or dad to love and care for them? Well, they don't stay children forever. No one magically becomes an adult the day they turn eighteen. Some people grow up sooner, many grow up later. Some never really do. But just remember that some people in this world are older versions of those same kids we cry for." -- Ashly Lorenzana

item.title: Robert add a quote by D.H. Mondfleur
item.description: "My mind’s terrain has become exceedingly rough. Emotional scars are changing my internal geography faster than the mapmaker can keep pace. Wrong turns and dead ends abound, and I’m afraid someday I’ll drown in a river I didn’t know was there." -- D.H. Mondfleur

item.title: Robert add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Life's single lesson: that there is more accident to it than a man can ever admit to in a lifetime and stay sane." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Robert add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robert add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again." -- Sylvia Plath
